title: Update Admin Panel Authentication to Use Custom Credentials

requirements.text: Update the Admin Panel page authentication logic in frontend/src/pages/AdminPanelPage.tsx to use the admin credentials: username 'admin' and password 'habibur123' (replacing the current default credentials 'admin'/'admin123').

quotes: Set the Admin Username as: admin
Set the Admin Password as: habibur123

acceptanceCriteria: The admin login form on the /admin-panel page accepts username 'admin' and password 'habibur123'
The previous credentials 'admin'/'admin123' no longer work
Successful login with the new credentials grants access to the user management interface
Failed login attempts display an appropriate error message
The authenticated session persists in sessionStorage as before

requirements.text: Ensure the admin credentials are stored securely in the frontend code without plain-text exposure in console logs or client-side debugging tools, using basic client-side credential verification suitable for a simple admin access control system.

quotes: Please implement this secure login system

acceptanceCriteria: Admin credentials are not logged to the browser console
The credential verification logic is contained within the AdminPanelPage component
The implementation maintains the existing sessionStorage-based session persistence
The login form includes basic client-side validation for empty fields

requirements.text: Test the updated admin authentication flow by verifying that an admin can successfully log in to /admin-panel using username 'admin' and password 'habibur123', view the list of registered users, and approve pending users without errors.

quotes: Let me know once it is deployed

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /admin-panel displays the login form
Entering 'admin' and 'habibur123' successfully authenticates and shows the user management interface
The UserListTable component displays all registered users with their current status
Clicking 'Approve' on a pending user successfully updates their status to 'Approved'
The admin session persists across page navigation within the /admin-panel route

constraints: Do not modify the backend user management system or approval logic
Preserve the existing sessionStorage-based admin session management approach
Keep the AdminPanelPage component structure and UserListTable integration unchanged except for the credential verification logic
Do not add external authentication libraries or complex encryption for this simple admin access control
nonGoals: Implementing backend-based admin authentication or role management
Adding password reset or forgot password functionality for admin access
Creating multiple admin user accounts with different permission levels
Implementing OAuth or third-party authentication for admin access
Adding admin activity logging or audit trails
